rSETSe 0.3
  • Reference

Preapre data for the `SETSe_core` function LEGACY

SETSe_data_prep_orig.Rd

This is becuase there were issues where an error appears ONLY when the function is as a package. the problem is summary(Adj)

SETSe_data_prep_orig(
  g,
  force,
  flow,
  distance,
  mass,
  edge_name = edge_name,
  k = "k",
  sparse = FALSE
)

Arguments

g

An igraph object of the network that is going to be turned into a spring embedding.
force

a character string. The node attribute that contains the force information for the network.
flow

A character string. This is the edge attribute that is the power flow on the edges.
distance

a character string. The edge attribute that contains the distance of the edge.
mass

A numeric. This is the mass constant of the nodes in normalised networks this is set to 1.
edge_name

a character string. The edge attribute that contains the names of all the edges.
sparse

Logical. Whether or not the function should be run using sparse matrices. must match the actual matrix, this could prob be automated

Details

The file outputs a named list containing
